column4: im getting the impression that i may end up installing 2k as documentation for networking issues in ubuntu seems to be extremely lacking
what's the problem?

I am finding no answers as of yet as to why my 8139too based smc2-1211tx nic can ping both internal and extrenal addresses as well as dns external names but can not telnet/http/irc anything..... any help?
did you try google?
ohhh yes
i been googling this issue for several hours
just found this http://www.ozzu.com/ftopic20882.html
there suggestion is to install freebsd :p
and i do have the correct module and driver and its the only pci card in system
a) are you sure it's the nic and not the network, b) do you have rtl8139 loaded?
do you use DHCP? did it get an IP from the gateway? is this is the only machine with problems?
a) no ....but i am using the network now on 2k b) yes its loaded and shows in the device manager
yes dhcp yes it has an ip and yes its the only machine with problems
did you try with a static IP or another nic?
is this the only linux distro you've used?
another nic is my next step but i need to know if ubuntu will recognize it or will i need to find and load the drivers
in my experience most drivers are loaded automatically with hotplug
i've had a rh shell and a few unix shells but im no pro
also all the nics i have are rtl8139 based so should that matter?
you used a new card? perhaps the old card was defective
does this card use the same driver?
